Articles.Content:
KSP Calculators

For MS Excel And LibreOffice Calc

May Also work with other equivalent programs

Trying to make the perfect orbits?

Hate plugging away at the scientific Calculator?

Well these KSP orbit calculators are for you

Semi Major Axis Calculator

Determines your SMA using just your AP,PE and name of orbiting body

Libre/OpenOffice Calc (.ods) http://www./?lap8z3fbk6liuqz

Ms Excel (.xls) http://www./?2co8xvxy896pd1z

Orbit Time Calculator (Orbital Period)

Determines your Orbital Peroid by SMA or AP/PE/Body

Libre/OpenOffice Calc (.ods) http://www./?6npfx1cbjuxu22e

Ms Excel (.xls) http://www./?p3o2wmahbt2n2jx

Satellite Formation Planner

Determines your parking orbit for making evenly spaced satellites

Coming Soon (later tonight)

Even more coming soon. Feel free to suggest more

Edited July 18, 2013 by Jonv4n
Added the DL link for the next spreadsheet

Very nice! Can't wait to see the Satellite Formation Planner. It would be very useful to have them all combined in one file, too, so they could share their input data...

Also, would it be possible to create a delta-v calculator for your ship that takes the Isp, mass and so on and spits out how fast it can get? Also (You asked for it!) a way to reverse engineer an orbit from its period would be neat!

Anyway, good work . Keep on doing!

Sincerely

Marrus Qermam

PS: Keeping an eye on this.

PPS: Did anyone see my jaw? I think I lost it when my mind blew up...

Edited July 22, 2013 by MarrusQ
Reworked grammar (again!)
